transcripts.text: We are the younger generation.  We are the ones who are going to be affected and therefore we demand justice.  What do we want?  Climate justice!  When do we want it?  Now!  Everyone should mobilise for the 20th and the 20th of September because this is a global issue which actually affects everyone.  We are all in the same boat so everyone should be concerned about this.
Me movilizo porque somos un movimiento mundial.
I'm striking because if we don't fight for our future now, soon we won't have a future left to fight for.
I will participate in the climate strike on September 20, 2019, because I believe that it is our responsibility to take care of our home.
And we stand with the youth who are taking a stance today and raising up their voice to be able to have a real impact.

Since last year, we have seen young people all over the world starting to take action.  Then we learned that climate change will affect not this era, but the next era.  I think it's important to be part of the global climate strike in September, because this could be the last chance we have to get the politicians up to act on the climate crisis.  I am leading a global climate strike.  I am joining the strikes.  We stand with Greta and all those fighting for our future.
We need you to be a part of it because we need every age involved.  Young people have been leading here, but now it's the job of the rest of us to back them up.

This shouldn't be the children's responsibility, because now the adults also need to help us.  So we are calling for them to strike from their work, because we need everyone.  There is nothing we can't do, and I mean, if not you should do it, then who else?  And if not we should do it now, then when should we do it?
